documentation.text:
@title Standard Merkle Tree functions
@author Freeverse.io, www.freeverse.io

This function will revert if nLevels = 0.
 nLeafs = 2**nLevels
  nLevels = 1 => 3 leafs = lev1 - root /// lev0 - 2 leafs
  nLevels = 2 => 7 leafs = lev2 - root /// lev1 - 2 leafs /// lev0 - 4 leafs

if nLevels = 1, we need 1 element in the proof
 if nLevels = 2, we need 2 elements...
        .
     ..   ..
   .. .. .. ..
   01 23 45 67

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "number of leafs is not = pow(2,nLevels)"

arguments.value: number of leafs is not = pow(2,nLevels)

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "number of leafs is not = pow(2,nLevels)"
